assessment_template_create_payload.title: New Client Assessment (Comprehensive)
assessment_template_create_payload.description: This 72-point assessment evaluates new client technical maturity, risk factors, and service requirements across 12 critical focus areas. Designed for MSPs to qualify prospects and identify engagement opportunities.

categories.title: Infrastructure & Hosting
categories.description: Evaluates server infrastructure, hosting models, and physical environment maturity.

questions.title: Infrastructure hosting model
questions.description: Assesses whether infrastructure is hosted in modern, scalable environments vs. legacy on-premises setups.
questions.remediation_tips: Cloud-first strategy reduces capital expenditure and improves scalability. Start with hybrid approach if full migration isn't feasible.

criteria.description: Entirely self-hosted in office/closet with no redundancy
Mix of self-hosted and some cloud services, inconsistent approach
Primarily cloud-hosted or professional colocation with proper redundancy
No servers or infrastructure

questions.scoring_instructions: Evaluate hosting approach - cloud/colo indicates modern thinking, self-hosted may signal budget constraints or legacy mindset.

questions.title: Virtualization platform and architecture
questions.description: Evaluates whether infrastructure uses modern virtualization vs. physical servers.
questions.remediation_tips: Migrate to hypervisor-based virtualization (Hyper-V, VMware) or cloud-native services for better resource utilization and disaster recovery.

criteria.description: Primarily physical servers or aging virtualization platform
Mix of physical and virtual, inconsistent virtualization strategy
Modern virtualization platform (Hyper-V, VMware, or cloud-native)
No servers or infrastructure

questions.scoring_instructions: Modern virtualization indicates technical maturity and easier management. Physical-only setups suggest outdated approaches.

questions.title: Server hardware age and support status
questions.description: Assesses whether physical infrastructure is current and under warranty.
questions.remediation_tips: Plan hardware refresh cycles every 4-5 years. Consider cloud migration to eliminate hardware refresh requirements.

criteria.description: Hardware >5 years old or out of warranty
Mix of current and aging hardware, some warranty gaps
Hardware <4 years old with active warranty coverage
Cloud-hosted or no physical infrastructure

questions.scoring_instructions: Out-of-warranty hardware indicates upcoming capital expenditure and higher risk of downtime.

questions.title: Operating system versions and support
questions.description: Evaluates whether server operating systems are current and supported by vendor.
questions.remediation_tips: Prioritize migration from unsupported OS versions (Windows Server 2012, etc.) to current supported versions.

criteria.description: Unsupported OS versions (Server 2012 R2 or older)
Mix of supported and legacy OS versions
All servers on supported OS versions (Server 2019+)
No servers or fully cloud-managed

questions.scoring_instructions: Unsupported OS versions create security vulnerabilities and compliance issues. Indicates maintenance discipline.

questions.title: Power protection and environmental controls
questions.description: Assesses UPS protection and environmental safeguards for critical infrastructure.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement UPS protection for all critical infrastructure. Consider professional colocation for better environmental controls.

criteria.description: No UPS protection or environmental controls
Basic UPS but inadequate runtime or missing environmental monitoring
Proper UPS with adequate runtime and environmental monitoring
Professional datacenter or cloud-hosted

questions.scoring_instructions: Lack of power protection indicates high risk of data loss and downtime. Shows operational maturity.

questions.title: Internet connectivity and redundancy
questions.description: Evaluates WAN connections and failover capabilities.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement redundant internet connections from different providers. Consider SD-WAN for automated failover.

criteria.description: Single internet connection with no backup
Primary connection with basic backup (cellular, etc.)
Redundant connections with automatic failover
Single location with adequate connectivity

questions.scoring_instructions: Single internet connection indicates business continuity risk. Multiple connections show operational maturity.

categories.title: Network & Security
categories.description: Assesses network architecture, wireless security, and perimeter protection.

questions.title: Network segmentation and VLAN strategy
questions.description: Evaluates whether networks are properly segmented for security and performance.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement VLANs to separate guest, corporate, and server traffic. Add network access control where possible.

criteria.description: Flat network with no segmentation
Basic segmentation but incomplete or inconsistent
Proper network segmentation with VLANs and access controls
Cloud-only or very simple network requirements

questions.scoring_instructions: Flat networks indicate security risks. Proper segmentation shows advanced network planning.

questions.title: Wireless network security and guest access
questions.description: Assesses wireless security protocols and guest network isolation.
questions.remediation_tips: Deploy WPA3 or WPA2-Enterprise with RADIUS authentication. Isolate guest networks from corporate resources.

criteria.description: WEP, open networks, or shared corporate/guest access
WPA2 with PSK but no guest isolation or weak authentication
WPA2/3-Enterprise with isolated guest network
No wireless networks

questions.scoring_instructions: Weak wireless security creates easy attack vectors. Guest access without isolation poses internal risks.

questions.title: Firewall and unified threat management
questions.description: Evaluates perimeter security devices and advanced threat protection.
questions.remediation_tips: Deploy next-generation firewall with IPS, content filtering, and malware protection. Ensure current security subscriptions.

criteria.description: No firewall, consumer router, or expired security subscriptions
Basic business firewall but limited advanced features
UTM/NGFW with current IPS, content filtering, and malware protection
Cloud-only environment with cloud-native security

questions.scoring_instructions: Basic firewalls provide minimal protection. UTM with current subscriptions indicates security investment.

questions.title: VPN and remote access security
questions.description: Assesses remote access solutions and security controls.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement modern VPN with MFA or zero-trust remote access. Disable direct RDP exposure.

criteria.description: RDP exposed to internet or no secure remote access
Basic VPN but no MFA or outdated authentication
Secure VPN with MFA or zero-trust remote access solution
No remote access requirements

questions.scoring_instructions: Outdated VPN or RDP exposure creates security vulnerabilities. Modern solutions indicate security awareness.

questions.title: DNS security and content filtering
questions.description: Evaluates DNS-based security controls and malicious site blocking.
questions.remediation_tips: Deploy DNS security service (Umbrella, etc.) to block malicious domains and provide visibility into threats.

criteria.description: Using public DNS with no filtering or protection
Basic DNS filtering but limited threat intelligence
Advanced DNS security with threat intelligence and reporting
Cloud-only with managed DNS security

questions.scoring_instructions: DNS security provides first line of defense against malware and phishing. Shows proactive security posture.

questions.title: Network monitoring and alerting
questions.description: Assesses visibility into network performance and security events.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement network monitoring for all critical devices with automated alerting for outages and performance issues.

criteria.description: No network monitoring or visibility tools
Basic monitoring but limited alerting or coverage
Comprehensive monitoring with automated alerts and reporting
Very simple network with minimal monitoring needs

questions.scoring_instructions: Network monitoring enables proactive issue resolution. Lack of monitoring indicates reactive IT approach.

categories.title: Endpoint Protection
categories.description: Covers endpoint security, encryption, patch management, and device controls.

questions.title: Antivirus and endpoint detection/response
questions.description: Evaluates endpoint security solutions and threat detection capabilities.
questions.remediation_tips: Upgrade to EDR or MDR solution for better threat detection and response. Ensure 24/7 monitoring coverage.

criteria.description: No endpoint protection or outdated/expired solutions
Basic antivirus but no advanced threat detection
EDR/MDR with 24/7 monitoring and threat response
No endpoints to protect

questions.scoring_instructions: Traditional AV provides basic protection. EDR/MDR indicates advanced security posture and threat response capability.

questions.title: Device encryption and data protection
questions.description: Assesses encryption status of laptops, workstations, and mobile devices.
questions.remediation_tips: Deploy BitLocker or equivalent encryption on all devices. Implement centralized key recovery and reporting.

criteria.description: No device encryption implemented
Partial encryption or no centralized key management
Full device encryption with centralized key management
No mobile devices or laptops

questions.scoring_instructions: Unencrypted devices create data breach risk. Full encryption with key management shows security maturity.

questions.title: Patch management and update process
questions.description: Evaluates systematic patching of operating systems and applications.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement automated patch management with testing groups and scheduled deployment windows.

criteria.description: Manual patching or systems significantly behind on updates
Inconsistent patching process or OS-only coverage
Automated patch management for OS and third-party applications
Fully cloud-managed environment

questions.scoring_instructions: Manual patching creates security gaps. Automated patch management indicates operational maturity.

questions.title: Application control and software restrictions
questions.description: Assesses controls preventing unauthorized software installation and execution.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement application whitelisting or controlled folder access to prevent unauthorized software execution.

criteria.description: Users can install any software without restrictions
Limited administrative restrictions but no application control
Application whitelisting or controlled folder access implemented
Locked-down environment or cloud-only applications

questions.scoring_instructions: Application control prevents malware execution and reduces attack surface. Shows advanced security implementation.

questions.title: Device compliance and screen lock policies
questions.description: Evaluates device configuration policies and security controls.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement device compliance policies through MDM or Group Policy. Enforce screen lock timeouts.

criteria.description: No device policies or screen lock enforcement
Basic policies but inconsistent enforcement
Comprehensive device compliance with automated enforcement
No managed devices

questions.scoring_instructions: Device compliance ensures consistent security posture. Screen locks prevent physical access risks.

questions.title: Local administrator access control
questions.description: Assesses restriction of local administrative privileges on workstations.
questions.remediation_tips: Remove local admin rights from standard users. Implement privileged access management or LAPS for administrative tasks.

criteria.description: Users have local admin rights or shared admin accounts
Limited admin access but not consistently enforced
Restricted admin access with privileged access management
Cloud-only or highly restricted environment

questions.scoring_instructions: Unrestricted admin access increases malware risk. Controlled admin access shows security discipline.

categories.title: Identity & Access Management
categories.description: Covers directory services, user lifecycle, MFA, and access controls.

questions.title: Directory services and organizational structure
questions.description: Evaluates Active Directory or cloud directory implementation and organization.
questions.remediation_tips: Organize users into proper OUs, implement group-based access, and clean up inactive accounts regularly.

criteria.description: Workgroup or poorly organized directory with inactive accounts
Basic domain but poor organization or many inactive accounts
Well-organized directory with clean account management
Cloud-only with minimal user management needs

questions.scoring_instructions: Well-structured directory indicates IT maturity. Poor organization suggests ad-hoc user management.

questions.title: Multi-factor authentication implementation
questions.description: Assesses MFA deployment across critical systems and user accounts.
questions.remediation_tips: Deploy MFA for all administrative accounts immediately, then roll out to all users. Start with Microsoft Authenticator or similar.

criteria.description: No MFA implemented anywhere
MFA on some systems but not comprehensive
MFA required for all administrative and external access
Single user environment

questions.scoring_instructions: MFA significantly reduces breach risk. Lack of MFA indicates high security vulnerability.

questions.title: Password policies and complexity requirements
questions.description: Evaluates password policy implementation and enforcement across systems.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement modern password policies with length requirements and complexity. Consider passwordless authentication.

criteria.description: No password policy or very weak requirements
Basic password policy but not consistently enforced
Strong password policy consistently enforced across all systems
Passwordless or SSO-only environment

questions.scoring_instructions: Strong password policies reduce credential-based attacks. Weak or unenforced policies indicate security gaps.

questions.title: User onboarding and offboarding process
questions.description: Assesses systematic processes for managing user account lifecycle.
questions.remediation_tips: Document onboarding/offboarding checklists. Implement automated account provisioning and regular access reviews.

criteria.description: Ad-hoc user management with no defined processes
Basic processes but inconsistently followed
Documented processes with regular access reviews
Very small team with minimal user changes

questions.scoring_instructions: Poor lifecycle management creates security risks from orphaned accounts. Good processes indicate operational maturity.

questions.title: Privileged account management and monitoring
questions.description: Evaluates management of administrative and service accounts.
questions.remediation_tips: Limit number of privileged accounts, implement password rotation, and monitor administrative activity.

criteria.description: Shared admin accounts or no privileged account controls
Limited privileged accounts but no password rotation
Privileged access management with automated password rotation
Cloud-only with identity provider management

questions.scoring_instructions: Poor privileged account management creates insider threat risks. Good controls indicate security maturity.

questions.title: Access permissions and regular review process
questions.description: Assesses regular review and cleanup of user access permissions.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement quarterly access reviews with documented approval processes. Use access governance tools where possible.

criteria.description: No regular access reviews or permission audits
Informal reviews but no documented process
Regular documented access reviews with approval workflows
Very simple access model with minimal complexity

questions.scoring_instructions: Regular access reviews prevent privilege creep. Lack of reviews indicates potential over-privileged accounts.

categories.title: Microsoft 365 & Collaboration
categories.description: Assesses M365 configuration, security settings, and collaboration tool management.

questions.title: Microsoft 365 security and compliance configuration
questions.description: Evaluates M365 security settings, conditional access, and compliance policies.
questions.remediation_tips: Enable Security Defaults at minimum, implement conditional access policies, and configure compliance settings.

criteria.description: Default settings with no security hardening
Basic security enabled but limited conditional access
Advanced security with conditional access and compliance policies
Not using Microsoft 365

questions.scoring_instructions: Default M365 settings provide minimal security. Advanced configuration shows security investment and expertise.

questions.title: SharePoint and OneDrive governance
questions.description: Assesses data governance, sharing policies, and access controls for collaboration platforms.
questions.remediation_tips: Configure sharing policies, implement data loss prevention, and establish governance framework for team sites.

criteria.description: Open sharing enabled with no governance policies
Basic sharing restrictions but limited governance
Comprehensive governance with DLP and controlled sharing
Not using SharePoint/OneDrive

questions.scoring_instructions: Poor governance creates data leak risks. Good governance indicates understanding of collaboration security.

questions.title: Microsoft Teams security and external access
questions.description: Evaluates Teams security settings, guest access controls, and meeting policies.
questions.remediation_tips: Configure guest access policies, implement meeting restrictions, and control external federation.

criteria.description: Open external access with no meeting or guest restrictions
Basic controls but limited external access policies
Secure configuration with controlled external access
Not using Microsoft Teams

questions.scoring_instructions: Open Teams access creates security risks. Controlled access with policies shows security awareness.

questions.title: Email security and advanced threat protection
questions.description: Assesses email security measures, anti-phishing, and attachment protection.
questions.remediation_tips: Deploy Defender for Office 365 or equivalent with anti-phishing, safe attachments, and safe links.

criteria.description: Basic Exchange protection only
Third-party email security but limited features
Advanced threat protection with anti-phishing and attachment scanning
Not using Exchange Online

questions.scoring_instructions: Email is primary attack vector. Advanced protection shows security investment and awareness.

questions.title: Mobile device management and application protection
questions.description: Evaluates MDM implementation and mobile application management policies.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement Intune or equivalent MDM with device compliance and application protection policies.

criteria.description: No mobile device management or protection
Basic MDM but limited application protection
Comprehensive MDM with application protection policies
No mobile device usage

questions.scoring_instructions: Unmanaged mobile devices create data access risks. MDM shows understanding of modern security needs.

questions.title: License management and optimization
questions.description: Assesses M365 license allocation, usage tracking, and cost optimization.
questions.remediation_tips: Regular license audits, remove unused licenses, and optimize license types based on actual usage patterns.

criteria.description: No license tracking or many unused/incorrect licenses
Basic license management but no regular optimization
Active license management with regular optimization
Very small license footprint

questions.scoring_instructions: Poor license management wastes budget. Good optimization shows cost awareness and planning.

categories.title: Backup & Recovery
categories.description: Covers backup strategy, retention, testing, and disaster recovery capabilities.

questions.title: Backup strategy and data coverage
questions.description: Evaluates comprehensive backup coverage of critical systems and data.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement 3-2-1 backup strategy covering all critical systems including cloud data (M365, etc.).

criteria.description: No backups or only backing up some systems
Backing up most systems but gaps in cloud data or endpoints
Comprehensive backup strategy covering all critical systems and cloud data
No critical data to back up

questions.scoring_instructions: Incomplete backup coverage creates business continuity risks. Comprehensive strategy shows operational maturity.

questions.title: Backup retention and offsite storage
questions.description: Assesses backup retention policies and protection against local disasters.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement automated offsite backup replication and establish retention policies based on business requirements.

criteria.description: Local backups only or very short retention periods
Some offsite backup but inconsistent or manual process
Automated offsite backups with appropriate retention policies
Cloud-native with built-in redundancy

questions.scoring_instructions: Local-only backups vulnerable to site disasters. Offsite storage shows business continuity planning.

questions.title: Backup testing and restore validation
questions.description: Evaluates regular testing of backup systems and restore procedures.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement monthly restore tests with documented procedures. Test full system recovery scenarios annually.

criteria.description: No backup testing or restore validation
Occasional testing but no regular schedule or documentation
Regular automated testing with documented restore procedures
No backup system to test

questions.scoring_instructions: Untested backups may fail when needed. Regular testing shows operational discipline and reliability.

questions.title: Recovery time and point objectives alignment
questions.description: Assesses whether backup strategy aligns with business recovery requirements.
questions.remediation_tips: Document business requirements for recovery time and data loss tolerance. Align backup strategy accordingly.

criteria.description: No defined RTO/RPO or backup strategy doesn't meet requirements
Basic understanding but backup strategy partially meets requirements
Documented RTO/RPO with backup strategy designed to meet requirements
Very simple requirements with minimal recovery needs

questions.scoring_instructions: Misaligned RTO/RPO indicates backup strategy doesn't meet business needs. Proper alignment shows planning maturity.

questions.title: Disaster recovery planning and documentation
questions.description: Evaluates documented procedures for major disaster scenarios and business continuity.
questions.remediation_tips: Document disaster recovery procedures, identify alternative work locations, and test DR plans annually.

criteria.description: No disaster recovery plan or procedures
Basic DR plan but not tested or outdated
Comprehensive DR plan with regular testing and updates
Cloud-only with provider-managed DR

questions.scoring_instructions: Lack of DR planning indicates high business risk. Documented plans show business continuity maturity.

questions.title: Backup monitoring and failure alerting
questions.description: Assesses proactive monitoring of backup jobs and automated failure notifications.
questions.remediation_tips: Configure automated alerts for backup failures, implement monitoring dashboards, and review backup reports regularly.

criteria.description: No backup monitoring or failure notifications
Basic monitoring but manual checking required
Automated monitoring with proactive failure alerting
No backup system to monitor

questions.scoring_instructions: Silent backup failures create false security. Active monitoring shows operational discipline.

categories.title: Policy & Compliance
categories.description: Evaluates security policies, regulatory compliance, and governance frameworks.

questions.title: Security policy framework and documentation
questions.description: Assesses existence and quality of documented security policies and procedures.
questions.remediation_tips: Develop security policy framework covering key areas: acceptable use, password, incident response, and data handling.

criteria.description: No documented security policies or procedures
Basic policies exist but outdated or incomplete
Comprehensive, current security policies with regular review
Very small organization with minimal policy needs

questions.scoring_instructions: Lack of policies indicates ad-hoc security approach. Well-documented policies show security governance maturity.

questions.title: Incident response plan and procedures
questions.description: Evaluates documented procedures for security incidents and breaches.
questions.remediation_tips: Develop incident response plan with roles, responsibilities, communication procedures, and escalation paths.

criteria.description: No incident response plan or procedures
Basic plan but not tested or lacks detail
Comprehensive plan with regular testing and updates
Relying on MSP incident response procedures

questions.scoring_instructions: Lack of incident response planning increases breach impact. Good planning shows security maturity.

questions.title: Data classification and handling procedures
questions.description: Assesses data governance, classification schemes, and handling requirements.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement data classification scheme and establish handling procedures for different data types and sensitivity levels.

criteria.description: No data classification or handling procedures
Basic understanding but no formal classification system
Formal data classification with documented handling procedures
No sensitive data or regulatory requirements

questions.scoring_instructions: Poor data governance creates compliance and breach risks. Good classification shows data security awareness.

questions.title: Regulatory compliance requirements and controls
questions.description: Evaluates understanding and implementation of applicable regulatory requirements.
questions.remediation_tips: Identify applicable regulations (HIPAA, PCI, SOX, etc.) and implement required controls with regular assessments.

criteria.description: No awareness of compliance requirements or controls
Aware of requirements but inconsistent implementation
Comprehensive compliance program with regular assessments
No specific regulatory requirements

questions.scoring_instructions: Compliance failures create legal and financial risks. Good compliance programs indicate risk management maturity.

questions.title: Security awareness training program
questions.description: Assesses employee security education and phishing awareness programs.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement regular security awareness training with phishing simulations and track completion rates.

criteria.description: No security awareness training or education
Occasional training but no formal program
Regular training program with phishing simulations
Single user organization

questions.scoring_instructions: Untrained users are the weakest security link. Good training programs reduce human error risks.

questions.title: Cyber liability insurance coverage
questions.description: Evaluates cyber insurance coverage and alignment with risk profile.
questions.remediation_tips: Obtain cyber liability insurance appropriate for business size and risk profile. Review coverage annually.

criteria.description: No cyber liability insurance coverage
Basic coverage but may not align with current risk profile
Comprehensive coverage aligned with business risk profile
Covered under broader business insurance

questions.scoring_instructions: Lack of cyber insurance indicates unmanaged financial risk. Good coverage shows risk transfer planning.

categories.title: Business Continuity Planning
categories.description: Evaluates organizational preparedness for extended outages and disaster scenarios.

questions.title: Business impact analysis and critical process identification
questions.description: Assesses understanding of critical business processes and impact of IT outages.
questions.remediation_tips: Conduct business impact analysis to identify critical processes, dependencies, and recovery time requirements.

criteria.description: No understanding of critical processes or outage impacts
Basic understanding but no formal analysis
Formal business impact analysis with documented priorities
Very simple business with minimal IT dependencies

questions.scoring_instructions: BIA identifies priorities for recovery planning. Lack of analysis indicates poor continuity planning.

questions.title: Alternative work locations and remote capabilities
questions.description: Evaluates ability to maintain operations from alternative locations during disruptions.
questions.remediation_tips: Establish remote work capabilities, identify alternative work locations, and ensure secure remote access.

criteria.description: No remote work capability or alternative locations
Limited remote capability or no formal alternative plans
Comprehensive remote work capability with alternative locations
Already fully remote or cloud-based operations

questions.scoring_instructions: Remote work capability reduces business continuity risks. Limited capability indicates vulnerability to site outages.

questions.title: Emergency communication procedures and contact lists
questions.description: Assesses emergency communication plans and stakeholder notification procedures.
questions.remediation_tips: Develop emergency communication plans with current contact lists and multiple communication channels.

criteria.description: No emergency communication procedures or contact lists
Basic procedures but outdated contacts or limited channels
Comprehensive communication plan with current contacts
Very small team with simple communication needs

questions.scoring_instructions: Poor communication during emergencies compounds problems. Good procedures show crisis management planning.

questions.title: Vendor and supplier continuity planning
questions.description: Evaluates backup arrangements for critical vendors and suppliers.
questions.remediation_tips: Identify critical vendors, assess their continuity plans, and establish backup supplier relationships.

criteria.description: Single vendors for critical services with no backup plans
Some vendor redundancy but no formal continuity assessment
Diversified vendors with documented continuity plans
Minimal vendor dependencies

questions.scoring_instructions: Single vendor dependencies create continuity risks. Backup arrangements show supply chain planning.

questions.title: Business continuity plan testing and exercises
questions.description: Assesses regular testing of continuity plans through tabletop or live exercises.
questions.remediation_tips: Conduct annual tabletop exercises and periodic live tests of continuity procedures.

criteria.description: No continuity plan testing or exercises
Informal testing but no regular schedule
Regular testing with documented results and improvements
No formal continuity plan to test

questions.scoring_instructions: Untested plans often fail during real incidents. Regular testing shows operational discipline.

questions.title: Supply chain resilience and diversification
questions.description: Evaluates diversification of critical suppliers and services to reduce dependencies.
questions.remediation_tips: Diversify critical suppliers, establish alternative sourcing arrangements, and monitor supplier health.

criteria.description: Heavy reliance on single suppliers for critical needs
Some diversification but key dependencies remain
Well-diversified supply chain with resilience planning
Minimal supply chain complexity

questions.scoring_instructions: Concentrated supply chains create systemic risks. Diversification shows risk management maturity.

categories.title: IT Operations & Monitoring
categories.description: Assesses system monitoring, documentation, and operational management practices.

questions.title: Infrastructure monitoring and proactive alerting
questions.description: Evaluates monitoring coverage of servers, network devices, and critical services.
questions.remediation_tips: Deploy comprehensive monitoring with automated alerting for all critical infrastructure components.

criteria.description: No monitoring or purely reactive approach
Basic monitoring but limited alerting or coverage gaps
Comprehensive monitoring with proactive alerting
Fully cloud-managed with provider monitoring

questions.scoring_instructions: Reactive IT creates more downtime and higher costs. Proactive monitoring indicates operational maturity.

questions.title: System documentation and configuration management
questions.description: Assesses quality and currency of technical documentation and configuration records.
questions.remediation_tips: Maintain current network diagrams, system configurations, and procedure documentation with regular updates.

criteria.description: No documentation or severely outdated information
Basic documentation but outdated or incomplete
Comprehensive, current documentation with regular updates
Simple environment with minimal documentation needs

questions.scoring_instructions: Poor documentation increases troubleshooting time and creates knowledge risks. Good documentation shows operational discipline.

questions.title: Change management and approval processes
questions.description: Evaluates systematic approach to IT changes and configuration control.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement change management process with approval workflows, testing requirements, and rollback procedures.

criteria.description: No change management or ad-hoc approach
Informal change process but not consistently followed
Formal change management with approval and testing
Cloud-managed environment with minimal changes

questions.scoring_instructions: Uncontrolled changes create stability risks. Good change management shows operational maturity.

questions.title: Performance monitoring and capacity planning
questions.description: Assesses tracking of system performance trends and future capacity requirements.
questions.remediation_tips: Monitor performance trends, establish capacity thresholds, and develop growth projections for infrastructure.

criteria.description: No performance monitoring or capacity planning
Basic performance monitoring but no formal capacity planning
Performance trends tracked with proactive capacity planning
Cloud-native with auto-scaling capabilities

questions.scoring_instructions: Lack of capacity planning leads to performance issues and reactive purchasing. Good planning shows operational foresight.

questions.title: Service level agreements and performance metrics
questions.description: Evaluates definition and tracking of IT service performance standards.
questions.remediation_tips: Define service level agreements for key IT services and implement metrics tracking and reporting.

criteria.description: No defined service levels or performance metrics
Informal expectations but no measured SLAs
Defined SLAs with regular performance reporting
Very simple environment with minimal service requirements

questions.scoring_instructions: Undefined service levels create expectation mismatches. Clear SLAs show professional service management.

questions.title: Asset inventory and lifecycle tracking
questions.description: Assesses tracking of IT assets, warranties, and replacement schedules.
questions.remediation_tips: Maintain current asset inventory with warranty dates and implement lifecycle replacement planning.

criteria.description: No asset tracking or inventory management
Basic inventory but no lifecycle or warranty tracking
Comprehensive asset management with lifecycle planning
Cloud-only with minimal physical assets

questions.scoring_instructions: Poor asset tracking leads to unexpected failures and budget surprises. Good tracking shows operational planning.

categories.title: Application & Data Management
categories.description: Covers business applications, data governance, and file management systems.

questions.title: Line of business application currency and support
questions.description: Evaluates whether critical business applications are current and under vendor support.
questions.remediation_tips: Audit all business applications for support status and plan upgrades or replacements for unsupported software.

criteria.description: Critical applications out of support or significantly outdated
Mix of current and legacy applications
All critical applications current and under vendor support
Cloud-only or very simple application needs

questions.scoring_instructions: Unsupported applications create security and operational risks. Current applications show technology investment.

questions.title: File sharing and collaboration platform strategy
questions.description: Assesses approach to file storage, sharing, and collaboration tools.
questions.remediation_tips: Standardize on secure collaboration platform with proper governance and access controls.

criteria.description: Multiple inconsistent file sharing methods or insecure sharing
Basic file sharing but limited governance or security
Unified collaboration platform with security and governance
Minimal file sharing requirements

questions.scoring_instructions: Inconsistent file sharing creates security risks. Unified strategy shows collaboration planning.

questions.title: Data retention and archival policies
questions.description: Evaluates systematic approach to data lifecycle management and retention requirements.
questions.remediation_tips: Develop data retention policies based on legal and business requirements with automated archival processes.

criteria.description: No data retention policies or uncontrolled data growth
Basic retention practices but no formal policies
Formal retention policies with automated enforcement
Minimal data retention requirements

questions.scoring_instructions: Poor data retention creates compliance and storage cost risks. Good policies show data governance maturity.

questions.title: Database management and maintenance practices
questions.description: Assesses database administration, maintenance, and performance optimization.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement regular database maintenance, monitoring, and backup validation with performance optimization.

criteria.description: No database maintenance or monitoring
Basic maintenance but no performance monitoring
Comprehensive database management with monitoring
Cloud-managed databases or no databases

questions.scoring_instructions: Poor database maintenance creates performance and reliability risks. Good practices show data management maturity.

questions.title: Application integration and API management
questions.description: Evaluates integration between systems and management of API connections.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement proper integration architecture with API management and monitoring for system connections.

criteria.description: No system integration or manual data transfer processes
Basic integration but inconsistent or unreliable
Well-architected integration with API management
Single application or no integration needs

questions.scoring_instructions: Poor integration creates data silos and manual work. Good integration shows system architecture maturity.

questions.title: Software licensing and compliance tracking
questions.description: Assesses tracking of software licenses and compliance with vendor agreements.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement software asset management with license tracking and regular compliance audits.

criteria.description: No license tracking or potential compliance issues
Basic tracking but no regular compliance audits
Comprehensive license management with compliance tracking
Minimal software licensing requirements

questions.scoring_instructions: License non-compliance creates legal and financial risks. Good tracking shows procurement discipline.

categories.title: Vendor & Technology Alignment
categories.description: Reviews vendor relationships, technology stack coherence, and strategic IT alignment.

questions.title: IT vendor relationship and contract management
questions.description: Assesses management of IT vendor relationships, contracts, and performance.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement vendor management program with contract tracking, performance reviews, and renewal planning.

criteria.description: No vendor management or contract tracking
Basic vendor relationships but no formal management
Formal vendor management with performance tracking
Minimal vendor relationships

questions.scoring_instructions: Poor vendor management creates service and cost risks. Good management shows procurement maturity.

questions.title: Technology stack standardization and coherence
questions.description: Evaluates consistency and integration of technology choices across the organization.
questions.remediation_tips: Develop technology standards and rationalize disparate tools to reduce complexity and improve integration.

criteria.description: Highly fragmented technology with many overlapping tools
Some standardization but significant fragmentation remains
Coherent technology stack with clear standards
Very simple technology environment

questions.scoring_instructions: Fragmented technology creates complexity and support costs. Coherent stack shows architectural planning.

questions.title: IT strategy alignment with business objectives
questions.description: Assesses how well IT decisions support and enable business goals.
questions.remediation_tips: Establish regular business-IT planning sessions and align technology investments with business priorities.

criteria.description: IT decisions made in isolation from business strategy
Some alignment but inconsistent strategic planning
Strong IT-business alignment with strategic planning
IT needs are very simple and straightforward

questions.scoring_instructions: Misaligned IT creates waste and missed opportunities. Good alignment shows strategic IT planning.

questions.title: Technology budgeting and financial planning
questions.description: Evaluates IT budget planning, cost tracking, and return on investment analysis.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement IT budget planning with cost tracking, ROI analysis, and regular budget reviews.

criteria.description: No IT budget planning or cost tracking
Basic budgeting but no ROI analysis or strategic planning
Comprehensive IT financial planning with ROI tracking
Very simple IT costs with minimal planning needs

questions.scoring_instructions: Poor IT budgeting leads to surprise costs and poor investment decisions. Good planning shows financial discipline.

questions.title: Innovation appetite and technology adoption strategy
questions.description: Assesses organizational openness to new technologies and innovation initiatives.
questions.remediation_tips: Develop innovation framework with pilot programs and systematic evaluation of new technologies.

criteria.description: Highly risk-averse with no innovation initiatives
Cautious approach but some openness to new technology
Balanced innovation strategy with systematic evaluation
Industry or role doesn't require innovation focus

questions.scoring_instructions: Risk aversion may limit competitive advantage. Balanced innovation shows strategic thinking.

questions.title: Support escalation and service management
questions.description: Evaluates processes for IT support, escalation procedures, and service request management.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement formal support processes with ticketing, escalation procedures, and service level tracking.

criteria.description: No formal support process or escalation procedures
Basic support but no formal escalation or tracking
Formal service management with escalation procedures
Single user or very simple support needs

questions.scoring_instructions: Poor support processes create user frustration and business impact. Good processes show service maturity.

categories.title: Endpoint Lifecycle Management
categories.description: Evaluates workstation and mobile device lifecycle, configuration, and management.

questions.title: Device age and warranty status tracking
questions.description: Assesses tracking of device age, warranty coverage, and replacement planning.
questions.remediation_tips: Maintain device inventory with warranty tracking and implement proactive replacement planning.

criteria.description: No tracking of device age or warranty status
Basic tracking but no proactive replacement planning
Comprehensive tracking with proactive lifecycle management
Very few devices or cloud-only environment

questions.scoring_instructions: Out-of-warranty devices create support risks and unexpected costs. Good tracking shows lifecycle planning.

questions.title: Device standardization and imaging processes
questions.description: Evaluates consistency of device configurations and automated deployment processes.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement standardized device configurations with automated imaging or provisioning processes.

criteria.description: No device standards or manual configuration processes
Some standardization but inconsistent deployment
Standardized devices with automated deployment
BYOD environment or minimal device management

questions.scoring_instructions: Device inconsistency increases support costs. Standardization shows operational efficiency.

questions.title: Endpoint security and compliance enforcement
questions.description: Assesses security controls and compliance enforcement on workstations and mobile devices.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement endpoint compliance policies with automated enforcement and regular compliance reporting.

criteria.description: No endpoint security policies or compliance checking
Basic security but limited compliance enforcement
Comprehensive endpoint security with compliance enforcement
No managed endpoints

questions.scoring_instructions: Non-compliant endpoints create security risks. Strong enforcement shows security discipline.

questions.title: Remote device management and support capabilities
questions.description: Evaluates ability to manage and support devices outside the office environment.
questions.remediation_tips: Deploy remote management tools with VPN or cloud-based device management capabilities.

criteria.description: No remote management capabilities
Limited remote access but inconsistent capabilities
Comprehensive remote management and support
All devices in single location

questions.scoring_instructions: Limited remote management increases support costs and response times. Good capabilities show modern IT practices.

questions.title: BYOD and mobile device governance
questions.description: Assesses policies and controls for personal devices accessing corporate resources.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement BYOD policies with MDM enforcement and application-level data protection.

criteria.description: Uncontrolled personal device access to corporate data
Basic BYOD policies but limited technical enforcement
Comprehensive BYOD governance with technical controls
No personal device usage

questions.scoring_instructions: Uncontrolled BYOD creates security and data risks. Good governance shows understanding of modern work patterns.

questions.title: Device refresh and lifecycle planning
questions.description: Evaluates systematic approach to device replacement and technology refresh cycles.
questions.remediation_tips: Develop device refresh schedule with budget planning and user communication processes.

criteria.description: Reactive device replacement with no planning
Some refresh planning but inconsistent execution
Systematic refresh planning with budget alignment
Very stable device environment with minimal refresh needs

questions.scoring_instructions: Reactive device replacement creates budget spikes and user disruption. Planned refresh shows financial and operational discipline.
